urls.title: What is a storm overflow and how do they work?
urls.description: Heard of a storm overflow but not sure what it is? Watch this to find out what they are, why they operate and what we do to minimise their impact on the wate...

tweets.text:
What are storm overflows, and why do we use them?

Storm overflows play a role in preventing sewage from entering our homes or streets during periods of heavy rain or storms.

Watch our video to find out more about storm overflows: https://t.co/VBJFNTBAVE

Can‚Äôt quite believe it but the @EnvAgency is 25 today! I was there at the start joining as an Assistant Hydrologist. So much has changed (albeit not my taste in shirts) but probably most dramatically and positively the public‚Äôs awareness of the environment & climate.  #ea25years https://t.co/3bxEiEVxZV

tweets.text:
And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/sUsBYs5msz

The Environment Agency is 25 years old today, but our rivers will not be celebrating. Yesterday, the EA announced that water companies had dumped raw sewage into our rivers for over 3 million hours from over 400,000 separate incidents. Read more here https://t.co/JqMCTl9hoc
@johncurtinEA @EnvAgency Happy Birthday üéÇ and thank you for an informative account üëå

#Youth voices demand to be heard, and the world needs to listen!
